channel.title: If then conditions help
channel.description:
Ok in my script I put:
[php]savescreenshot('newtext');[/php]
I obviously want it to take a screen shot of the screen, but.... Now, when I try to acces this file with scar it shows up as weird letters and symbols. When I try to open it with paint it says it cant be opened with this program. How do I access this file?

item.title: If then conditions help
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“junior, post:17, topic:51401”]Ok this is a question about if not() then conditions.
I have this in my script
if not (FindAxeHeadColor) then
Will that still call the procedure findaxeheadcolor, or just check to see if its false?[/quote]
It will call the procedure. In order to check if the function is true or false it has to actually run it.

Read full topic

item.title: If then conditions help
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Ok. I took a picture or a log, and then pasted it in paint. Now when its in paint I pressed ctrl + v to invert the colors. Now everything other then white I have colored black, so all you can see is the white outline of the log. I went into scar, bitmap to string of the mask I created, and used it in this procedure:
[php] if (FindBitmapMaskTolerance(logmask, x, y, mix1, miy1, mix2, miy2, 200, 200)) then
Mmouse(x, y, 8, 8)[/php]
Nothing happens when this procedure is called… Didnt I make the bitmap mask right? And do you see how high I set my tolerances?

EDIT: Solved, I just used the bitmap mask of the log that came with SRL’s itemlist.[br][size=1]Posted on: January 27, 2007, 12:14:43 AM[/size][hr]Ok this is a question about if not() then conditions.
I have this in my script
if not (FindAxeHeadColor) then
Will that still call the procedure findaxeheadcolor, or just check to see if its false?

Read full topic

item.title: If then conditions help
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

All right, Kaitnieks did it that way, so I took that for granted.

Read full topic

item.title: If then conditions help
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Fourth, get rid of that space after if.

It’s always been good coding practice to have a space before and after a parenthesis.

Read full topic

Are you gonna help me with mine or what?

item.title: If then conditions help
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:7, topic:51401”]By the way, even if you put in…

SaveScreenshot(‘example.jpg’);

It will still be saved as a BMP format file. Which is very high in filesize, so don’t think by putting in .jpg, it will change that.[/quote]

Rofl, my bad. I thought it saved as a jpg. Should have checked instead of guessing.

[quote=“junkj, post:12, topic:51401”]where i put the takescreen…

   if (FindMime) then
   begin
   writeln('lucky you, a mime!');
   takescreen;
   randomfound:=randomfound+1

The error…

Failed when compiling Line 142: [Error] (17204:11): Invalid number of parameters in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\autofighter v2.0.scar [/quote]

First of all, state which line is line 142. Second, put some semicolons where they belong. Third, if you forgot the end, put it there. Fourth, get rid of that space after if. Fifth, camel capitalize all the procedures/functions.

Read full topic

item.title: If then conditions help
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

You get an error. Try to run this.

program TestScreenshot;
begin
  ClearDebug;
  SaveScreenshot('screenshot.bmp');
end.

Tested and works. If that does not work, try this.

program TestScreenshot;
begin
  ClearDebug;
  SaveScreenshot(AppPath + 'screenshot.bmp');
end.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: If then conditions help
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

By the way, even if you put in…

SaveScreenshot(‘example.jpg’);

It will still be saved as a BMP format file. Which is very high in filesize, so don’t think by putting in .jpg, it will change that.

Read full topic

item.title: If then conditions help
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“junior, post:1, topic:51401”]Ok in my script I put:

[php]savescreenshot(‘newtext’);[/php]

I obviously want it to take a screen shot of the screen, but…
Now, when I try to acces this file with scar it shows up as weird letters and symbols. When I try to open it with paint it says it cant be opened with this program. How do I access this file?[/quote]

This is how windows teaches you shitty ideas. First, open a folder. Click Tools -> Folder Options. Click View. Uncheck “Hide extensions for known filetypes”. Now learn filetypes. It should be SaveScreenShot(‘newtext.jpg’).

Read full topic
